none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on November 19, 2013 Description from Terminal Escape:
The "no rules" approach to hardcore that epitomized the '90s  (with mixed but predominantly positive results) in the US seemed to turn into an unabashed love for metallic crust by the mid '00s (a love affair that has now also joined the ranks of the passé). But the early '00s also brought us these fools from Singapore, applying that '90s philosophy to aggressive and metallic multi vocal hardcore with roots in SXE, crust and charging hardcore punk. Yes, UNITED BY FATE sound a bit dated, but these ears perk with excitement when I feed them these sounds... BLOODSOIL
//2.bp.blogspot.com/-yRl__S2brJU/UosS53lwuhI/AAAAAAAAJBo/8tQiqax-8Hg/s1600/united+by+fate+cover.jpg //3.bp.blogspot.com/-eWZj60yvqWg/UosV78GbJ2I/AAAAAAAAJB0/RmXnVi3gCd8/s1600/united+by+fate+img.jpg

seo.title: United By Fate - Bloodsoil cassette - Terminal Escape
